content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "FASTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

bad tests cases this code will pass all test but fail for 2 validators, because of negatives values.

r = input()
c = [*map(int,input().split())]
l=len(c)
a = sum(c)//len(c)
q = int((sum([i*i for i in c])//len(c))**.5)
p=1
for i in c:p*=i
g = int(p**(1/l))

print(dict(A=a, Q=q, G=g)[r])

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A good clash to play. Can be solved in under 5 minutes. There are links to Wikipedia to explain what is a quadratic mean and geometric mean which is helpful to people who is trying to understand the task. 
The task is well-explained and it is a bit challenging to solve. 
The test cases covered both three means.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun, difficulty ok, I learned something, explanation clear and documented

I liked the clash, but I got some difficulties understanding at first :
- you didn't precise round down for the quadratic mean but you did for the others (If the string r is Q output the Quadratic mean)
- you forgot the ² for the quadratic example, so the example is not working :
Quadratic mean of 1 2 3 4 5 = square root of( ( 1² + 2² + 3² + 4² + 5² ) / 5 ) = 3

I edited these 2 mistakes, and it's good for me !
it is quite good as it makes the means clear.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This contribution was kinda fun for me, even it is a bit easy ( just implementation of formulas ), but it can be tricky for shortest, and it can show who is faster in fastest. I would like to try this in shortest because I solved it in 145 chars, without golfing, it would be fun to compete with others who can shorten it the most. In fastest, I think I would be able to solve it in less than 2 min, maybe even less if I'm on "fire". Anyway, I like this contribution and I approve it.
You should explain what quadratic and geometric means are. I also don't see the challenge in this puzzle. Just use a formula?

1. Please remove the constraint entirely. Especially that flavour text of ":) XD" is unnecessary.
2. "take out" should be revised as "output".
3. Please revise your puzzle as it is too trivial and unoriginal. There are already this similar contribution https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/5548a74068cee159db7ca45a8ffe7b7c97b
and this slightly more interesting contribution https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/45834c96ca3047eca14d9c68257842282070
Hmmm it's easy but it's great to combine what we learned in school with coding to make life a little easier
ahhhh yes i don't have any idea for a contribute but you are right i was not thinking it is created, ok i will try another thing

yes but you need to combine what you learn in math to make the life easy my contribute wants to make you know that some simple things can make your life so easy and you are right thanks for your feedback I need to explain what is the  quadratic and geometric  and arithmetic means
Happy For That!

Please refer to point 3 of https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

"CoC statements should be self-sufficient. (doesn't apply to reverse puzzles obviously)

When your time is counted, as a player, you don't want to waste time searching for a formula or a definition online to understand what needs to be done."

Please include the definitions required in your statement directly.
Thanks.
hey bro is it good now i edit it and added a Mediator

The only definitions of "mediator" I can find on wikipedia are here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mediation_(statistics)
and here: https://mathworld.wolfram.com/Mediator.html
I think your definition may not be a well-known one.
thank you, you are helping me a lot can you say for me what I need to put in the Statement?
are you meaning that the mediator of 3 4 5 not 4 ?
The point is, I'm not sure how many fellow coders understand what a mediator is. I don't know what it is myself. If they don't, they may be frustrated by your puzzle.
ok i will remove the mediator and put the Quadratic mean and the Geometric mean

I'm not sure about those terms either. I guess you may have to put in the definitions and calculation examples in the statement.
And in any case, is it really a good idea to have a statistics question as a clash of code puzzle? Is it fun?
i love math and that is fun for me!
